#summary API documentation

= API documentation =

Brief list of available functions, objects, properties and methods

== Global functions ==
  * `[global].include` - include script file
  * `[global].quit` - terminate execution
  * `[global].system.env` - hash with environment variables. Read-only.
  * `[global].system.stdin(count, [binary])` - read `count` bytes from standard input. If `binary == true`, data is returned as an array of numbers.
  * `[global].system.stdout(data)` - write `data` to standard output. Data can be either string of array of numbers (ascii values).

  * `[global].File` - file class
  * `[global].MySQL` - mysql class

== File functions ==
  * `var f = new File(fileName)` - creates new file instance
  * `f.open(mode)` - opens the file with a given mode
  * `f.close()` - closes the file
  * `f.read([count], [binary])` - reads `count` (or all) bytes from file.
  * `f.write(data)` - writes `data` to the file
  * `f.remove()` - deletes the file
  * `f.getSize()` - returns file size
  * `f.toString()` - returns file name
